article: With supper finished, it was our time with Dad. Cindy, Tom and I climbed onto our couch. We all waited for Mom to turn on the old tape player.  Dad had been piloting airplanes in Vietnam for the Air Force for a year. Through the year, our family received at least one _ a week from Dad. Mom played a part to us every day. Every day when Mom turned on the tape player, Dad _ by asking each of us how our _ had gone and what we had done. _ to the tape machine as if he could hear every word, each of us told him about our _ . Because Mom wrote down our responses, Dad was kept _ . In the following tape, he _ our good deeds and _ corrected our errors. After _ told Dad their tales, he read to us from the book Mom had sent.  The day Dad was to _ , all of us were playing around the swimming pool . Then the gate in the fence opened. A tall man in a _ walked through the gate.  My eldest sister jumped off the diving board and ran towards the man. Mom ran behind. The man embraced Mom and kissed her.  _ by the scene, Tom and I looked at each other. Soon, the tall, uniformed man arrived at the pool's edge and smiled _ at us. With the innocence of a four-year-old girl, I looked up and _ , "Are you my father?"  He burst into tears, knelt down, _ us into his arms and said, "Yes, I'm your father." The moment I heard his voice, I _ him as my father because it was the same _ that I heard so frequently on tape.
